name: AUN/Phantom Ghost (Denovali, Slipcase CD)
description:
CD comes in special thick printed cardboard inner and outer sleeves.
LABEL INFOS:
New full length of this groundbreaking Canadian duo! AUN’s previous travels took the duo to space, hell and back. Now home to tackle more earthly concerns ‘Phantom Ghost’ shows AUN at its most complex and determined, but also at its most accessible, while still quite adept to their use of extreme tones. Previous outings heralded as masterpieces of ambient and heavy psychedelic strains, ‘Phantom Ghost’ finds AUN’s considerable stylistic palette, augmented again.  Fractured voice and locked dry, immovable, hypnotic rhythms, and AUN's ethereal and experimental qualities, now find themselves magnified by a sound edging on indie-noise-rock, while also delving deeper into their penchant for pristine and shattered electronics.  Drenched in celestial gazy-prog sheen, fuelled by blurry acid drenched dreams, ‘Phantom Ghost’ is AUN at its most otherworldly, but also most grounded and terrestrial. The Phantom and Ghost in focus here, could easily be of the supernatural variety, but are more the result of complex sound wave apparitions during the recording process. Very human in its essence and execution, but also increasingly beautifully machine driven, ‘Phantom Ghost’ is a wide new door opened by the constantly mutating AUN. NEWZ/REVIEWZ: http://www.facebook.com/AUNandAUN

name: AUN/VII (Important, Digipack)
description:
Featuring Away (Voivod) on drums!

AUN/VII (prees excerpts)
‘Exceptional...'immense recording'-Zero Tolerance (UK) 
‘To rank alongside of Godflesh’s Pure’-Wire (UK) 
‘Doom dirge greatness’-Rock A Rolla (UK) 
‘Absolutely essential listening’ Foxy Digitalis (USA) 
‘ A sonic acid trip’ 4.3/5-Nightlife (Canada) 
‘Slow, low, mysterious, heavy and beautiful’-Aquarius (USA) 
‘Massive noise doom psych record’-Anti Gravity Bunny (USA)

name: AUN/Black Pyramid (Cyclic Law, Digipack)
description: DRONE RECORDS REVIW: guitar based dark drones of a tremendous power, waving blocks of distorted cosmic psychedelia (using synths & violin), polyphonic harmonies seem to be everywhere... a true masterpiece by the Canadian drone-project, highly recommended !
